chapter x

    chapter xi

    chapter xii
la femme la plus séduisante de pétersbourg

her own special and
peculiar form

her short-waisted, lace-trimmed, dainty gray
dress
a stout, heavily built young man
either the military or civil service
the clever though shy, but observant and natural, expression
a silent, now a too-noisy group

an
unexpectedly kind and pleasant smile

that she had obtained an
invitation

the vicomte, polite
but hopeless: “the sovereigns, madame
the elegant, newly decorated, and luxurious dining room
the best, most friendly and simplest relations
some eight or nine young men
